step1_outline.prompt:
You are a professional chef and dietitian tasked with creating a guideline for a weekly meal plan and shopping list based on user preferences and constraints.result: give a rough meal outline for the week (main dish names only, no recipes yet) along with a draft shopping list of  ~{ingredient_limit} unique non-pantry ingredients needed. Return ONLY JSON with two keys: mealOutline and draftShoppingList.
Rules:
1) NO leftovers, NO repeat main dishes across the week.
2) Balance variety with practicality: reuse overlapping ingredients across meals when reasonable. 
3) Seasonings (oils/sauces/spices) and Pantry staples (rice/pasta/flour/canned beans/oats/bread) do NOT count toward the limit and must be category=seasonings.
4) Only include meals selected in CookSchedule; unselected meals should be [] or omitted.
5) Meal outline: the amount of dishes per selected meal should be appropriate for the number of people and meal type.
6) draftShoppingList must be derived from the outline and include unique items with name + category only (no quantities, no duplicates).
7) Valid categories: proteins, vegetables, fruits, grains, dairy, seasonings, pantry_staples, others.
BudgetUSD: 120
People: 2
Preferences: ["quick","high protein","asian flavors"]
Dislikes: ["tree nuts"]
CookSchedule: {"monday":["lunch","dinner"],"tuesday":["lunch","dinner"],"wednesday":["lunch","dinner"],"thursday":["lunch","dinner"],"friday":["breakfast","lunch","dinner"],"saturday":["breakfast","lunch","dinner"],"sunday":["breakfast","lunch","dinner"]}
OutputSchema: {"mealOutline":{"monday":{"breakfast":["Avocado toast"],"lunch":["Chicken salad"],"dinner":["Stir-fry"]},"tuesday":{"breakfast":[],"lunch":["Tuna sandwich"],"dinner":[]},"...":"..."},"draftShoppingList":[{"name":"chicken breast","category":"proteins"},{"name":"rice","category":"grains"},{"name":"olive oil","category":"seasonings"}]}
RETURN ONLY THE RAW JSON OBJECT. Do not use Markdown formatting (no ```json blocks).

step2_structured_menu.prompt: Step 2: Create a high-quality, nutritious, and structured weekly meal plan within the ingredient constraints. Requirements: 1) DraftShoppingList is the source of truth for NON-pantry items. Do NOT add new non-pantry items. You may add pantry_staples/seasonings only when needed (keep minimal). 2) MealOutline is guidance for dish ideas; feel free to improve dish names and recipes, but stay within the shopping list. 3) Focus on high-quality, nutritious, and varied meals that fit Preferences/Dislikes/Budget/People. Avoid repeating the exact same dish. 4) Only include meals selected in CookSchedule; unselected meals must be [] or omitted. 5) Servings MUST equal People for every dish. 6) Ingredient categories: proteins, vegetables, fruits, grains, dairy, seasonings, pantry_staples, others. 7) instructions <=200 characters and include clear steps.  RETURN ONLY THE RAW JSON OBJECT. lunch.name: Spicy Tuna and Cucumber Rice Bowls
lunch.instructions: 1. Cook rice. 2. Mix tuna with sriracha and soy sauce. 3. Slice cucumber. 4. Assemble bowls and top with green onions.

dinner.name: Ginger Garlic Chicken Stir-fry
dinner.instructions: 1. Sauté sliced chicken until browned. 2. Add minced ginger, garlic, and beans. 3. Stir-fry with soy sauce until tender. Serve with rice.

lunch.name: Asian-style Chicken Salad Wraps
lunch.instructions: 1. Poach and shred chicken. 2. Shred cabbage and toss with oil and vinegar. 3. Mix and serve in cabbage leaf wraps.

dinner.name: Szechuan Beef and Green Bean Skillet
dinner.instructions: 1. Brown beef in a skillet. 2. Add garlic and green beans. 3. Season with sriracha and soy sauce. 4. Cook until beans are crisp-tender.

lunch.name: Cold Sesame Beef Noodle Salad
lunch.instructions: 1. Boil noodles and chill. 2. Sear thinly sliced beef. 3. Toss noodles with beef, cucumber, and sesame oil dressing.

dinner.name: Honey Soy Glazed Salmon
dinner.instructions: 1. Mix honey and soy. 2. Sear salmon, brushing with glaze. 3. Steam bok choy alongside. Serve with rice.

lunch.name: Salmon and Avocado Sushi Bowls
lunch.instructions: 1. Cook rice and season with vinegar. 2. Pan-sear salmon and flake. 3. Slice avocado. 4. Assemble with soy sauce.

dinner.name: Thai Basil Ground Pork Stir-fry
dinner.instructions: 1. Fry garlic, then brown pork. 2. Add soy sauce and sriracha. 3. Fold in basil until wilted. Serve over rice.

breakfast.name: Soft Scrambled Eggs with Chives
breakfast.instructions: 1. Whisk eggs. 2. Cook on low heat, stirring constantly for soft curd. 3. Fold in chopped green onions.

lunch.name: Pork and Cabbage Potsticker Bowls
lunch.instructions: 1. Brown pork with ginger. 2. Add shredded cabbage and cook until soft. 3. Season with soy and sesame oil.

dinner.name: Miso Butter Cod with Bok Choy
dinner.instructions: 1. Rub cod with miso. 2. Pan-sear until flaky. 3. Steam bok choy in the same pan with a splash of water.

breakfast.name: Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese Bagels
breakfast.instructions: 1. Toast bread/bagel. 2. Spread cream cheese. 3. Layer smoked salmon and thin cucumber slices.

lunch.name: Teriyaki Shrimp Skewers
lunch.instructions: 1. Marinate shrimp in honey, soy, and garlic. 2. Grill or pan-sear for 2 mins per side. Serve with rice.

dinner.name: Korean BBQ Beef Bulgogi Bowls
dinner.instructions: 1. Slice beef very thin. 2. Marinate in soy, honey, and sesame oil. 3. Sear on high heat. Serve over rice.

breakfast.name: Savory Congee with Soft Boiled Eggs
breakfast.instructions: 1. Boil rice in 4 cups water/broth until porridge-like. 2. Stir in ginger. 3. Top with 6-minute boiled eggs.

lunch.name: Shrimp and Vegetable Rice Bowl
lunch.instructions: 1. Sauté shrimp and vegetables. 2. Season with soy and ginger. 3. Serve over a bed of steamed rice.

dinner.name: Lemon Lemongrass Chicken Thighs
dinner.instructions: 1. Mince lemongrass and garlic. 2. Rub onto chicken with honey and soy. 3. Pan-roast until skin is crispy.

step3_shopping_list.prompt:
Step 3: Generate a consolidated shopping list from the structured weekly meal plan.
CRITICAL RULES:
1) MERGE only true duplicates or very close synonyms (e.g., bell pepper/peppers -> bell peppers). Do NOT merge clearly different items (spinach vs broccoli, ginger vs garlic, green onion vs onion).
2) UNITS (North America): proteins -> lbs or oz; produce -> count or bunch; grains/dairy/pantry_staples/others -> oz/lbs/count as appropriate. Use a single unit per item.
3) Sum quantities across all dishes. For lbs/oz round to 1 decimal; for count/bunch use whole numbers.
4) Valid categories: proteins, vegetables, fruits, grains, dairy, seasonings, pantry_staples, others.
5) Keep names concise (<= 5 words). Avoid brands and extra adjectives.
6) For seasonings (oils/sauces/spices), use totalQuantity 0 and unit "".
7) Respond with compact JSON only (no comments or prose).
